Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay, lets tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to understand the normative process description thoroughly. The process starts with Receive order, followed by Check inventory. Depending on inventory sufficiency, the process branches into two paths: one for sufficient inventory and another for insufficient. For sufficient inventory, the sequence should be: Receive Check Authorize Payment Package Ship Close. If inventory is insufficient, the path is: Receive Check Cancel Close. Key constraints are that payment authorization must come after checking inventory, packaging after authorization, shipping after packaging, and closing at the end. Also, after cancellation, there should be no shipping or fulfillment activities.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now, looking at the event log with five cases: Case 1: The sequence is Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close. This follows the sufficient inventory path correctly. No deviations here.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2: The activities are Receive Check Package Authorize Ship Close. Here, Package items occurs before Authorize payment. According to the normative process, authorization should come before packaging. This is a violation because packaging should only happen after payment is authorized.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3: The sequence is Receive Check Authorize Cancel Ship Close. After cancellation (Cancel order), the process shouldnt proceed to Ship order. Shipping after cancellation is a violation. Also, once you cancel, you should close the order without any shipping step.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 4: The path is Receive Check Cancel Close. This follows the insufficient inventory path correctly. No issues here.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 5: The activities are Receive Check Authorize Ship Close. Missing Package items before shipping. According to the process, items must be packaged before shipping. Skipping packaging is a violation.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So, Cases 2, 3, and 5 have deviations. Case 2 violates the order of Authorize before Package. Case 3 violates by shipping after cancellation and not closing immediately after cancel. Case 5 skips packaging entirely before shipping.
